content: A `Slider` allows users to select a value from a range. It can also be a range slider by passing an array to the `defaultValue` or `value` prop.
Key features include setting `minValue`, `maxValue`, and `step`. You can show steps (`showSteps`) and `marks`. The slider can be oriented `vertically`.
You can display a tooltip with the current value by using the `showTooltip` prop. The format of the tooltip's value can be customized with `getTooltipValue` or `tooltipValueFormatOptions`.
The thumb, label, and value display can all be customized using the `renderThumb`, `renderLabel`, and `renderValue` props, respectively.
A Slider can be a controlled component. Use the `value` prop and the `onChange` event to manage its state. `onChangeEnd` can be used to get the value only when the user stops dragging.
